comments:
I got the following dump when I tried starting eclipse today, but after it 
failed, I tried reopening and things opened fine.  I know this is vague, but 
it's all I really have on the situation:

!ENTRY org.vssplugin 1 0 Feb 18, 2003 10:17:57.667
!MESSAGE Using jawin library 
C:/Apps/eclipse/plugins/org.vssplugin_1.2.1/lib/jawin.dll

I don't understand your setup.  It looks like its trying to get the provider 
for a CVS Project, but on stack I also see:

	at org.vssplugin.ui.LabelDecorator.getProvider(LabelDecorator.java:358)
	at org.vssplugin.ui.LabelDecorator.decorateText

My read of the stack trace is that in trying to get the decoration for your 
vssplugin, its trying to instantiate the CVS provider.

Are you reusing CVS classes to implement your vssplugin? Or do you just happen 
to have both types of projects in the workspace being decorated and I am 
misinterpreting the stack trace?

I do have both types of projects (CVS and VSS) in my workspace.  Now, I've 
noticed this issue occur every day for the past week.  Today however I've 
upgraded my VSS plugin to v1.3, and thusfar I have not seen any issues.  I'll 
keep you posted if I receive another such error during startup.  I'll also try 
to remember to empty my log so that its fresh.

I wonder if the VSS plugin.xml was using the cvs provider's provider ID instead 
of their own?  I could see that happening if someone copied the CVS plugin to 
get started and forgot to change it.
I am closing assuming the new VSS plugin has solved it.  If not, pls reopen.
